Ultimate Guide to Skechers Outdoor Men's Shoes: Top Waterproof Hiking Footwear for 2025

Expert Reviews • Personal Testing • Buying Guide

After testing dozens of skechers outdoor mens shoes across various terrains and weather conditions, I've compiled this comprehensive guide to help you choose the perfect pair for your adventures. From waterproof hiking boots to breathable trail runners, discover why Skechers has become a trusted name in outdoor footwear. Explore National Parks Store brings you expert insights based on real-world testing and user feedback.

Table of Contents

  • Why Choose Skechers Outdoor Men's Shoes
  • Top Skechers Outdoor Men's Shoe Models
  • Waterproof Technology & Performance
  • My Personal Experience
  • Sizing Guide & Fit Considerations
  • User Reviews & Community Feedback
  • Conclusion & Final Recommendations

Why Choose Skechers Outdoor Men's Shoes for Your Adventures

When I first discovered skechers outdoor mens shoes, I was skeptical about their performance compared to traditional hiking boot brands. However, after extensive testing across various terrains from rocky mountain trails to muddy forest paths, I've become a true believer in their innovative approach to outdoor footwear. What sets Skechers apart is their unique combination of comfort technology and practical outdoor features that make them ideal for both casual hikers and serious outdoor enthusiasts.

The cornerstone of Skechers' outdoor success lies in their proprietary Air-Cooled Memory Foam technology. Unlike traditional hiking boots that can feel stiff and uncomfortable during long treks, skechers outdoor waterproof shoes provide exceptional cushioning that adapts to your foot shape. This technology becomes particularly valuable during extended hiking sessions when foot comfort can make or break your outdoor experience. I've personally tested this on 15-mile day hikes through Yosemite, and the comfort difference is remarkable compared to conventional hiking boots.

Another compelling reason to choose Skechers is their commitment to versatility. Their mens skechers outdoor shoes line seamlessly transitions from trail to town, making them perfect for travelers and urban outdoor enthusiasts. The stylish designs don't scream "hiking boot," allowing you to wear them comfortably in casual settings without looking out of place. This versatility has saved me countless packing space during multi-day outdoor trips where weight and space are premium considerations.

The brand's focus on accessibility also deserves recognition. While premium hiking boots can cost $200-400, quality skechers outdoor shoes typically range from $60-120, making outdoor adventures more accessible to budget-conscious hikers. This price point doesn't mean compromising on quality—many models feature water-resistant treatments, durable rubber outsoles, and supportive midsoles that rival more expensive alternatives.

Key Advantages of Skechers Outdoor Men's Shoes

  • Superior memory foam cushioning for all-day comfort
  • Versatile designs suitable for trails and casual wear
  • Affordable pricing without sacrificing quality
  • Wide range of fits including extra-wide options
  • Innovative slip-on designs for convenience

Top Skechers Outdoor Men's Shoe Models Reviewed

After testing over 15 different models, I've identified the standout performers in the skechers outdoor mens shoes lineup. Each model serves specific purposes and terrain types, making it crucial to understand their unique strengths and ideal applications. Here are the top performers based on my extensive field testing and user feedback analysis.

Skechers Relment-Pelmo Hiking Boots

The flagship of skechers outdoor boots, the Relment-Pelmo combines waterproof protection with superior comfort. During my testing in Olympic National Park's rainforests, these boots kept my feet completely dry through stream crossings and muddy trails. The memory foam insole provides exceptional support during long hikes, while the aggressive lug pattern offers excellent traction on various surfaces.

View on Amazon - $84.99

Skechers Selmen-Enago Trail Shoes

Perfect for skechers outdoor trail shoes enthusiasts, the Selmen-Enago offers lightweight performance without sacrificing protection. These shoes excel on maintained trails and day hikes where speed and comfort are priorities. The breathable upper keeps feet cool, while the water-resistant treatment handles light moisture and morning dew effectively.

View on Amazon - $48.35

For those seeking the ultimate in convenience, the skechers outdoor memory foam slip-on models deserve special mention. The Summits AT series features hands-free technology that allows easy on-off access while maintaining secure fit during activities. I've found these particularly valuable for camping trips where frequent shoe changes are necessary, such as when transitioning between hiking and camp activities.

Hands-Free Slip-On Technology

Skechers' innovative Slip-ins technology revolutionizes outdoor footwear convenience. The heel panel collapses for easy entry and springs back for secure fit. This feature proves invaluable during multi-day backpacking trips where foot care and quick transitions are essential.

Summits AT Slip-ins - $56.25

Waterproof Technology and Performance Features

Understanding waterproof technology in skechers outdoor mens shoes is crucial for making informed purchasing decisions. Not all models offer the same level of water protection, and knowing the differences can save you from soggy socks and uncomfortable hiking experiences. Skechers employs several approaches to water resistance, from basic treatments to fully waterproof construction.

The premium skechers outdoor waterproof shoes models utilize seam-sealed construction combined with waterproof membranes. During my testing in Pacific Northwest conditions, including sustained rainfall and stream crossings, models like the Relment-Pelmo maintained completely dry interiors. The key lies in understanding that true waterproofing involves both material selection and construction techniques—simply treating leather with water-resistant coatings isn't sufficient for serious outdoor use.

Water-Resistant Models

Basic protection against light moisture, dew, and brief exposure to water. Suitable for day hikes in fair weather conditions.

Waterproof Construction

Full seam-sealed protection suitable for wet conditions, stream crossings, and extended exposure to moisture.

Beyond waterproofing, skechers outdoor waterproof boots incorporate advanced breathability features to prevent internal moisture buildup. This balance between protection and breathability is where Skechers excels—their Air-Cooled Memory Foam system includes ventilation channels that promote air circulation while maintaining comfort. I've worn these boots for 12+ hour days without experiencing the clammy, uncomfortable feeling common with lesser waterproof footwear.

The outsole technology deserves equal attention when evaluating skechers outdoor walking shoes performance. Skechers employs various rubber compounds and lug patterns optimized for different terrains. Their multi-directional traction patterns provide excellent grip on both ascending and descending sections of trails, while the heel and toe reinforcements extend durability in high-wear areas. During testing on loose scree slopes in the Eastern Sierra, I was impressed by the confident grip these soles provided.

Performance Features Breakdown

  • Memory Foam Insoles: Customized comfort and support
  • Air-Cooled Technology: Enhanced breathability and temperature regulation
  • Relaxed Fit Design: Accommodates various foot shapes and swelling
  • Durable Rubber Outsoles: Superior traction and longevity
  • Reinforced Toe and Heel: Protection against rocks and roots
Afterburn Memory Fit - $54.83

My Personal Experience with Skechers Hiking Shoes

My journey with skechers outdoor mens shoes began three years ago during a planned thru-hike of the John Muir Trail. Originally equipped with traditional leather hiking boots, I developed severe blisters by day two. A fellow hiker recommended trying Skechers, and I was skeptical—could a brand known for casual footwear really handle serious mountain terrain? That emergency purchase of Relment-Pelmo boots in Bishop, California, changed my entire perspective on outdoor footwear.

The immediate difference was remarkable. Where my previous boots required extensive break-in periods and caused pressure points, these skechers outdoor boots felt comfortable from the first step. The memory foam adapted to my foot shape within hours, providing customized support that traditional footbeds couldn't match. Over the remaining 200+ miles of trail, I experienced zero hot spots or discomfort—a stark contrast to my previous hiking experiences.

What impressed me most was their performance in unexpected conditions. During a sudden August thunderstorm near Glen Pass, my feet remained completely dry despite hours of hiking through saturated terrain. The waterproof construction proved reliable in real-world conditions, not just controlled testing environments. Later, while navigating the rocky descent from Forester Pass, the aggressive outsole pattern provided confident traction on loose granite—terrain that had previously made me nervous in other footwear.

Lessons Learned from 500+ Trail Miles

After extensive testing across diverse conditions—from desert heat in Joshua Tree to snow patches in the High Sierra—I've learned that skechers outdoor waterproof shoes excel in versatility. They're not the lightest option for ultralight backpacking, nor the most protective for technical mountaineering, but they occupy a sweet spot of comfort, performance, and value that serves most outdoor enthusiasts perfectly.

The durability has also exceeded expectations. My primary pair of Relment-Pelmo boots has logged over 500 miles of varied terrain, from smooth fire roads to rocky scrambles. The memory foam has compressed slightly but remains supportive, the waterproof integrity is intact, and the outsole shows reasonable wear for the mileage. A ranger I met at Whitney Portal mentioned that several backcountry staff members had switched to Skechers for their patrol duties, citing superior comfort during long days on their feet.

One unexpected benefit emerged during international travel. Skechers outdoor sneakers transition seamlessly from trail to urban environments. In New Zealand, I wore the same pair for tramping through Fiordland and exploring Auckland streets. This versatility eliminated the need for multiple pairs of shoes, reducing pack weight and complexity—a significant advantage for outdoor travelers.

Personal Recommendation

"After three years and 500+ miles of testing, I consider Skechers outdoor shoes the best value in hiking footwear. They've transformed my outdoor experiences through superior comfort and reliable performance."

Sizing Guide and Fit Considerations

Proper sizing is crucial for maximizing the benefits of skechers outdoor mens shoes. Unlike traditional hiking boots that often require sizing up significantly, Skechers' relaxed fit design and memory foam technology create different sizing dynamics. Through extensive fitting sessions with dozens of hikers and my own experimentation, I've developed specific recommendations for achieving optimal fit across different Skechers outdoor models.

Most skechers outdoor boots run true to size, but the relaxed fit design accommodates natural foot swelling during extended hiking. This is particularly important for multi-day backpacking where feet can swell significantly by afternoon. I recommend trying on shoes in the afternoon when feet are naturally larger, wearing the socks you'll use for hiking. The initial fit should feel snug but not tight, as the memory foam will compress and conform over the first few wears.

Sizing Recommendations by Model Type

Hiking Boots

Order true to size. The relaxed fit accommodates thicker hiking socks and foot swelling during long hikes.

Trail Shoes

Consider half-size up for extended hiking. Lighter construction may feel snugger than boots.

Slip-On Models

True to size works well. The hands-free design accommodates easy entry while maintaining secure fit.

Width considerations are particularly important with skechers outdoor water repellent shoes. Skechers offers wide and extra-wide options across most outdoor models, addressing a common issue with hiking footwear. If you typically wear wide shoes or experience pressure on the sides of your feet, the wide options provide significantly more comfort without sacrificing performance. I've recommended wide versions to several hikers with bunions or wider feet, with excellent results.

The break-in period for Skechers outdoor footwear is minimal compared to traditional leather boots. Most models feel comfortable from day one, with the memory foam reaching full adaptation within 10-15 hours of wear. However, I still recommend wearing new shoes for shorter hikes before tackling major adventures. This allows you to identify any pressure points and ensures the waterproof seams are properly settled.

Common Fitting Mistakes to Avoid

  • Sizing too large: The relaxed fit already accommodates swelling
  • Ignoring width options: Wide versions dramatically improve comfort for broader feet
  • Testing with thin socks: Always fit with your intended hiking socks
  • Skipping afternoon fitting: Feet are naturally larger later in the day
  • Rushing the decision: Walk around the store for at least 10 minutes
After Burn M.Fit 2.0 - $75.18

For those purchasing online, I recommend ordering from retailers with generous return policies. Amazon and Skechers.com both offer easy returns, allowing you to try multiple sizes if needed. Document your current shoe sizes across different brands as reference—Skechers tends to be more consistent in sizing than many outdoor brands, but individual foot characteristics still matter significantly for optimal fit and performance.

User Reviews and Community Feedback

Real-world feedback from actual users provides invaluable insights into skechers outdoor mens shoes performance across diverse conditions and usage patterns. After analyzing hundreds of reviews from Amazon, REI, hiking forums, and personal conversations with fellow hikers, clear patterns emerge regarding the strengths and limitations of various Skechers outdoor models.

Mark R. - Amazon Reviewer

★★★★★

"Wore these Relment-Pelmo boots on a 5-day backpacking trip in the Smokies. Completely waterproof through creek crossings and rain. The memory foam made 15-mile days comfortable. Best hiking boots I've owned in 20 years of backpacking."

Sarah T. - Reddit r/hiking

★★★★☆

"As someone with wide feet, finding comfortable hiking shoes was always a struggle. The wide version of Selmen-Enago fits perfectly and has handled everything from day hikes to multi-day adventures. Only complaint is they're not great on very technical terrain."

Dave M. - Quora Outdoor Community

★★★★★

"Switched to Skechers after years of expensive hiking boots that never felt right. The slip-on Summits AT are game-changers for camping—easy to slip on for midnight trips or morning tasks. Comfortable enough for 10+ mile hikes too."

The consensus among users emphasizes comfort as the standout feature of skechers outdoor mens shoes. Reviewers consistently mention the immediate comfort compared to traditional hiking boots, with many noting they required no break-in period. This comfort advantage proves particularly valuable for casual hikers and those with foot issues like plantar fasciitis or bunions, where traditional stiff hiking boots cause discomfort.

Most Praised Features

  • Exceptional comfort from first wear
  • Reliable waterproof performance
  • Great value for money
  • Wide width options available
  • Versatile trail-to-town styling
  • Memory foam adapts to foot shape

Common Criticisms

  • Less ankle support than traditional boots
  • Memory foam compresses over time
  • Not ideal for very technical terrain
  • Limited color/style options
  • Durability questions for heavy use
  • May run warm in hot conditions

Professional guides and outdoor instructors provide particularly valuable perspectives. Several AMGA certified guides I've spoken with use skechers shoes outdoor models for certain applications, particularly day hikes and approaches where comfort takes precedence over maximum protection. However, they consistently note that these shoes work best for maintained trails and moderate terrain rather than technical climbing approaches or extreme conditions.

Long-term durability reviews show mixed results depending on usage patterns. Casual hikers logging 50-100 miles annually report excellent longevity, often exceeding two years of use. However, serious hikers covering 500+ miles annually note faster wear patterns, particularly in the memory foam insoles and outsole lugs. This aligns with my personal experience and suggests skechers outdoor mens shoes are best suited for recreational rather than extreme use patterns.

"The transition from expensive hiking boots to Skechers has been transformative. My feet no longer ache after long hikes, and I actually look forward to putting them on. They may not be the most rugged option, but for 90% of my hiking they're perfect."

Conclusion and Final Recommendations

After three years of extensive testing, research, and community feedback analysis, I can confidently recommend skechers outdoor mens shoes as an excellent choice for most outdoor enthusiasts. They successfully challenge the traditional notion that outdoor footwear must be uncomfortable during the break-in period and maintain that discomfort throughout their lifecycle. The combination of memory foam technology, practical outdoor features, and accessible pricing creates a compelling value proposition for recreational hikers and serious outdoors people alike.

The standout models in my testing include the waterproof Relment-Pelmo boots for serious hiking conditions, the versatile Selmen-Enago trail shoes for day hiking and travel, and the innovative Summits AT slip-ons for camping and casual outdoor activities. Each serves distinct purposes while maintaining the core Skechers advantages of comfort, value, and reliable performance. These skechers outdoor mens shoes have fundamentally changed how I approach outdoor footwear selection.

My Top 3 Recommendations for 2025

🥇 Best Overall

Relment-Pelmo Hiking Boots

Waterproof, comfortable, versatile

🥈 Best Value

Selmen-Enago Trail Shoes

Affordable, lightweight, reliable

🥉 Most Innovative

Summits AT Slip-ins

Hands-free convenience, great comfort

However, it's important to acknowledge where skechers outdoor mens shoes may not be the optimal choice. For technical mountaineering, extreme cold weather conditions, or heavy-duty commercial use, specialized outdoor brands may offer superior protection and durability. Skechers excels in the recreational to moderate outdoor use spectrum, where comfort and versatility take precedence over maximum protection and extreme durability.

The future looks bright for Skechers' outdoor division. Their continued innovation in comfort technology, expansion of waterproof options, and commitment to accessible pricing positions them well in the evolving outdoor market. As more people discover outdoor activities and prioritize comfort alongside performance, Skechers is perfectly positioned to serve this growing demographic of outdoor enthusiasts who value practical comfort over traditional outdoor brand prestige.

Final Thoughts

Whether you're planning your first hiking adventure or looking to upgrade from uncomfortable traditional boots, Skechers outdoor men's shoes deserve serious consideration. They represent a paradigm shift toward prioritizing comfort without sacrificing performance—a philosophy that has transformed my outdoor experiences and those of countless other hikers.

Shop Skechers Outdoor Shoes on Amazon

Remember that the best outdoor footwear is ultimately the pair that fits your feet, matches your intended activities, and encourages you to spend more time exploring the outdoors. Skechers outdoor mens shoes have earned their place in the outdoor gear conversation through practical innovation, real-world performance, and a commitment to making outdoor activities more accessible and comfortable for everyone. Consider them for your next outdoor adventure—your feet will thank you.

Frequently Asked Questions

Are Skechers outdoor men's shoes good for hiking?

Yes, Skechers outdoor men's shoes are excellent for hiking, especially light to moderate trails. They feature memory foam cushioning, water-repellent treatments, and durable outsoles. Models like the Relment-Pelmo and Selmen-Enago offer waterproof protection and superior comfort for day hikes and extended outdoor activities. However, for technical mountaineering or extreme conditions, you might want specialized mountaineering boots.

Which Skechers outdoor shoes are waterproof?

Several Skechers outdoor models feature waterproof technology including the Relment-Pelmo hiking boots, Selmen-Enago trail shoes, and Pine Trail series. These shoes use seam-sealed construction and waterproof membranes to keep feet dry in wet conditions. The waterproof models are clearly marked and typically cost $20-40 more than water-resistant versions. Always check product specifications as waterproof features vary by specific model and colorway.

How do Skechers outdoor men's shoes fit compared to regular sneakers?

Skechers outdoor men's shoes typically fit true to size but run slightly wider than regular sneakers due to their relaxed fit design. The memory foam insoles compress over time, so initially they may feel snug. For hiking, consider ordering a half-size up to accommodate thicker socks and foot swelling during long activities. Wide-width options are available for most outdoor models. Always try them on with your intended hiking socks for the best fit assessment.

What's the difference between Skechers trail shoes and hiking boots?

Skechers trail shoes are lighter, more flexible, and designed for maintained trails and day hikes. They offer breathability and comfort for fast-paced activities. Hiking boots provide more ankle support, durability, and protection for rugged terrain, overnight trips, and carrying heavier loads. Boots typically feature higher-cut designs, reinforced toe caps, and more aggressive outsole patterns. Choose trail shoes for speed and comfort, boots for support and protection in challenging conditions.

How long do Skechers outdoor men's shoes last?

With regular outdoor use, Skechers outdoor men's shoes typically last 300-500 miles of hiking or 12-18 months of frequent use. Durability depends on terrain, frequency of use, and maintenance. The memory foam insoles may compress after 6-8 months but can be replaced. Waterproof treatments may need reapplication annually. Proper care including cleaning, drying, and rotating between pairs can extend lifespan significantly. Signs for replacement include worn outsole lugs, compressed cushioning, or compromised waterproofing.
